author: Pavan Dahat
text:
A witness in the gang-rape case of a 21-year-old student from Bhilai town in Durg district of Chhattisgarh attempted suicide by injecting lethal drugs on Tuesday, according to sources.

The witness, Sonal Mehar, works as a nurse in the same hospital where the 21-year-old was allegedly gang-raped by two police constables and a doctor in June 2014.

Last week, the victim committed suicide, blaming the three accused and “pressure and harassment by lawyers.” The victim’s brother had also claimed that the family was being “threatened and pressured” to withdraw the case.

According to sources, Mehar has been admitted to the Intensive Care Unit of a hospital in Bhilai and she is said to be out of danger. The police and Mehar’s father, however, have ruled out any connection between her suicide attempt and the gang-rape case.

According to certain sources, Mehar had turned “extremely religious” in the last one year and was also in the habit of visiting places of worship frequently.

The police also found a suicide note from her room in which she had asked her family “not to cremate her body but to bury” it.

The Superintendent of Police, Durg district, Mayank Shrivastav, later said the nurse had given her statement to the police.

Probe under way

On the progress in the case of suicide of the gang-rape victim, Mr. Shrivastav said that a three-member police team was inquiring into it.
title: Bhilai gang-rape case witness attempts suicide
